result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. November 3, 2022.

Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.

3:56 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Blake M Wilson in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Blake M Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Griffis provides an update; he is requesting the matter be set for a 1 day jury trial.  State agrees.  Court will adjourn for jury status and jury trial.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:32 PM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Blake M Wilson in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Blake M Wilson.  Atty. Griffis provides an update; he is still waiting on discovery but should have it by this afternoon, and he is still waiting on an offer.  Atty. Griffis requests a further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

8:48 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Blake M Wilson in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Blake M Wilson. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Griffis is appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
